Article_Name: Fresh Snowfall In Many Parts Of Kashmir
News Info: Fresh snowfall was recorded in many parts of Kashmir on Tuesday even as Srinagar city was lashed by sleet due to western disturbances affecting the region, officials said.

Article_Name: "Melania Trump Told Modi She'll Only See Delhi Schools": Arvind Kejriwal
News Info: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has revealed he has found an important fan of his government's work on improving school infrastructure and education in the national capital.

Article_Name: Dera Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim, Out Of Jail For 21 Days, Gets Z-Plus Security
News Info: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh has been given Z-plus security cover during his 21-day release on furlough from a Haryana jail where he has been serving a sentence, officials said on Tuesday.

Article_Name: Ukraine Crisis: UK To Impose Sanctions On 5 Russian Banks
News Info: Britain will impose sanctions on five Russian banks and three "very high-net worth individuals" following the deployment of troops to two Moscow-backed regions of Ukraine, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said Tuesday.

Article_Name: 5-Month-Old's Medicine Costs Rs 18 Crore, Father Approaches High Court
News Info: The Kerala High Court has sought response of the state government on a plea seeking medical assistance for a five month old baby suffering from spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) for which the medicine costs around Rs 18 crore.

Article_Name: China Promises To "Work For Early Return" Of Stranded Indian Students
News Info: China has promised to India to work for the "early return" of over 23,000 Indian students stranded at home for over two years due to Beijing's rigid COVID-19 visa ban and assured New Delhi that they will not be discriminated against in any manner.

Article_Name: In DMK's Big Win Today, A Crucial Region Switches From Rival AIADMK
News Info: Tamil Nadu's ruling DMK headed for a big win today in local polls held after a gap of 10 years, snatching a region that was considered loyal to the opposition AIADMK.

Article_Name: Bajrang Dal Man's Murder Linked To Hijab Ban: Karnataka College Principal
News Info: The vice principal of a college in Karnataka's Udupi, which was the first to ban the hijab on campus, has alleged the murder of a 25-year-old member of the right-wing Bajrang Dal in the state was linked to the controversy over the hijab ban.

Article_Name: Mumbai Court Denies Interim Bail To Actor Armaan Kohli In Drugs Case
News Info: A special NDPS court in Mumbai on Tuesday denied interim bail to actor Armaan Kohli, who was arrested by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) for alleged possession and consumption of drugs.

Article_Name: Russia Urges Other Countries To Recognise Ukraine Separatist Regions
News Info: Russia on Tuesday called on other countries to "follow" it in recognising east Ukraine's separatist republics, a day after President Vladimir Putin did so and ordered the Russian army to send troops there as "peacekeepers."

Article_Name: "In Favour Of World Peace": Rajnath Singh On Ukraine Crisis
News Info: Stressing that India stands for peace, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said the Russia-Ukraine dispute should be resolved through talks.

Article_Name: India Needs Tough Leader For Difficult Times: PM Modi In Uttar Pradesh
News Info: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said when turmoil in prevailing in the world, India needs to be stronger and for difficult times, a tough leader is needed.

Article_Name: "(Bajrang Dal) Brothers Won't Let This Go": Killed Karnataka Man's Sister
News Info: The sister of the Bajranj Dal man whose killing set off a massive row in Karnataka since Sunday, told NDTV today that her "brothers" - right wing men in the Bajrang Dal  will not "let the issue go so easily" and they will get her "justice".

Article_Name: Syria Supports Vladimir Putin's Recognition Of Ukraine Breakaway Regions
News Info: Syria supports the decision of its ally Russia to recognise two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine, Syrian state TV quoted the Syrian foreign minister as saying on Tuesday.

Article_Name: Distance No Insulation, Indo-Pacific Issues May Extend Till Europe: India
News Info: Greater power and stronger capabilities should lead to responsibility and restraint and result in economics free of coercion and politics devoid of the threat of use of force, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Tuesday.
